definition: prefix or suffix of a compound word/affix (linguistics)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to sew/to stitch together/to combine/to link/to connect/to put words together/to compose/to embellish
affix stripping/to determine the root of a word by removing prefix and suffix

sentences.english: It refers to the formation of new words by adding affixes to other words or morphemes.
sentences.chinese: 将词缀加入其他单词或词素以构成新词的方法。

sentences.english: The affixes of adjectives are large and diverse.
sentences.chinese: 形容词的词缀量大且多样。

sentences.english: A stem can be defined as a form to which affixes of any kind can be added.
sentences.chinese: 词干的定义是任何词缀可以加于其上的词的主要部分。

sentences.english: What are the morphological rules that govern the use of the given derivational affixes?
sentences.chinese: 所给屈折词缀的用法的形态学规则是哪些？

sentences.english: Generally, affixes can not be added to morphemes of a different language origin.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，词缀不能添加到语素的不同的语言起源。

sentences.english: Affixation is quite a controversial issue in the circle of Chinese linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 词缀是汉语语言学界颇有争议的问题。

sentences.english: Affix using one of the crank arm fixing bolts.
sentences.chinese: 词缀使用其中的一个曲柄臂固定螺栓。
